body_html:
I'm having the same problem as @acburigo

pip show tensorflow-gpu
...
Location: C:\Users[USER NAME]\appdata\local\conda\conda\envs\carnd-term1\lib\site-packages
...

There's a bunch of stuff there but I don't see a DLL. There are tensorflow and tensorflow_gpu-1.1.0.dist-info directories in there. tensorflow/python seems to be the location of the pywrap_tensorflow_internal.py that's generating the error.

@drpngx do you know where there is supposed to be a tensorflow DLL? The only DLLs in that whole tensorflow directory appear to be _gru_ops.dll and _lstm_ops.dll

body:
I'm having the same problem as @acburigo 

> pip show tensorflow-gpu
...
Location:  C:\Users\[USER NAME]\appdata\local\conda\conda\envs\carnd-term1\lib\site-packages
...

There's a bunch of stuff there but I don't see a DLL.  There are `tensorflow` and `tensorflow_gpu-1.1.0.dist-info` directories in there.  `tensorflow/python` seems to be the location of the pywrap_tensorflow_internal.py that's generating the error.

@drpngx  do you know where there is supposed to be a tensorflow DLL?  The only DLLs in that whole tensorflow directory appear to be `_gru_ops.dll` and `_lstm_ops.dll`
